posts.title: The shortest (and cheapest) way to achieving all 12 AWS certifications
posts.description: After completing all 12 AWS certifications and earning my golden jacket, I want to share the most efficient and cost-effective path I discovered. Learn about certification strategy, learning approaches, and maximizing AWS program benefits.

posts.title: How to Replace Your CMS with a Static Site Using Amazon Q CLI Chat
posts.description: I tackled the AWS Builder Challenge #cloud-launch-challenge-1 by completely rebuilding my consulting website in under 5 hours. Discover how to replace WordPress with a modern static architecture using Amazon Q CLI Chat as your AI pair programming partner.

posts.title: AWS User Group Poitiers: Recap of the Serverless PHP Meetup with AFUP Poitiers
posts.description: Lambda was in the spotlight at the latest AWS User Group Poitiers meeting, along with Bref, a PHP runtime dedicated to serverless.

posts.title: Event-Driven Architecture: Reconciling Notifications and Complete Events
posts.description: Minimalist or complete events? In event-driven architecture, different models exist. We propose here a way to simply reconcile the different approaches.

posts.title: Your S3 Bucket Objects Might Be Public Even If the AWS Console Says Otherwise
posts.description: S3 is an incredible storage service, capable of durably storing data at scale. In this blog article, I'll show you a little-known way your objects could become public by mistake.

posts.title: Protect Your Applications from Attacks with AWS CloudFront and AWS WAF
posts.description: Discover how to effectively protect your web applications against malicious attacks using AWS CloudFront and AWS WAF.

posts.title: Use Your ECS Container (Even on Fargate) as a Bastion to Access Your Database with Local Port Forwarding
posts.description: Discover how to use an ECS container on Fargate as a bastion to access your private databases.

posts.title: Cloud 101 - Episode 3: 7 Keys to Avoid Waste ðŸ’° - FinOps
posts.description: Recurring joke among cloud engineers: 'what's expensive in the cloud isn't so much the resources you use as those you forgot to turn off'.

posts.title: Extend Amazon Connect Capabilities with Lambda and Lex v2
posts.description: Discover how to extend Amazon Connect functionalities using AWS Lambda and Amazon Lex V2.

posts.title: Cloud 101 - Episode 2: SysOps, 10 Services for Your On-Premises Infrastructure
posts.description: Discover 10 essential AWS services to manage your on-premises infrastructure like a pro.

posts.title: Cloud 101 - Episode 1: What is the Real Added Value of the Cloud?
posts.description: First part of our Cloud 101 series: understanding the real added value of cloud computing.

posts.title: Make or Buy? Assemble!
posts.description: Reflection on technological choices: should you develop or buy? What if the answer was to assemble?

posts.title: Cloud Agnostic or Cloud Native?
posts.description: Analysis of the advantages and disadvantages between a cloud agnostic and cloud native approach.

posts.title: Agility: A Matter of Trust to Build
posts.description: I was fortunate to be introduced to agility within a team of seasoned developers. Later, I had the opportunity to help start five agile development teams.

posts.title: Deploy a Simple Data Storage API with Very Little Code Using Amazon API Gateway and DynamoDB
posts.description: Tutorial to quickly create a storage API with AWS API Gateway and DynamoDB.

posts.title: AWS re:Invent 2022: Our Review
posts.description: Review of the AWS re:Invent 2022 event with our impressions and notable announcements.

posts.title: PowerBI: Deploy a Gateway on AWS for $0.12/day
posts.description: Guide to deploy a PowerBI gateway on AWS economically.
